result.execSummary:
The defendant Donna E. Schroeder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Donna E. Schroeder is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Donna E. Schroeder was found guilty of Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Count #1:
The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $400+ costs = $957, to be paid in $25 per month installments commencing on 8/1/16/16 and on the 1st day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 5 day jail term.

records.addlTxt: Final Notice
Associated with Charge #1
Criminal Case Settlement

Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV:

Case called at 12:30pm [mo]
Defendant Donna E. Schroeder in court with Attorney Thomas J Laitsch.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Count #2

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel.

On Count #1:
The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $400+ costs = $957, to be paid in $25 per month installments commencing on 8/1/16/16 and on the 1st day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 5 day jail term.
recess : 12:39pm
Status conference on June 27, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV:  
[MK] case called at 2:51pm. 
Defendant Donna E. Schroeder in court with Attorney Thomas J Laitsch.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Laitsch requests the scheduling of another status conference; he would like more time to informally meet with ADA Teuber to work toward a case resolution.  He has not received the requested discovery, so he does not know 
The Court grants the request.
DA Happ voices the State's position that at the next hearing the State will be asking that a jury trial be scheduled.
On request of Attorney Laitsch, the Court excuses the Defendant's personal appearance at the June 27th Status Conference if the case is not proceeding to a plea and sentencing on that date.  
recess 2:55pm. 

NEXT:  Status Conference on 6/27/16 at 11:00am  (JA- please include reminder in comments that the Defendant's personal appearance has been excused at this hearing unless the intend is to proceed to plea and sentencing)

[MK] case called at 10:06am.
Defendant Donna E. Schroeder in court.  ADA Monica Hall appear for the State of Wisconsin. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the chargesa nd maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel given
After Ms. Schroeder indicates that she intends to apply at the PD Office for representation, the Court adjourns the Initial Appearance. 
The Court instructs Ms. Schroeder to go the PD Office today.

The Court requires $500  signature bond, with conditions: 
--no contact with Georgia McWilliam
--not to drive without a valid drivers license and valid registration
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.
recess  10:08am
